intro: Atriplex semilunaris var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender saltbush, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a white, powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss in dry environments. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is adapted to saline soils and can thrive in areas with low rainfall. This variety is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardiness and ability to stabilize soil.
